method.text: Place the plain and white chocolate pieces in separate heatproof bowls. Place each over pans of simmering water. Heat gently for 3-5 min or until melted. Remove from the heat and cool slightly.

Stir 2 tablespoons of the hazelnut oil into each bowl of chocolate to make it more manageable. (If you are using cooking chocolate you will only need to add half the amount of oil because the chocolate will be so much thinner to begin with.)
Spoon teaspoonfuls of the chocolate over each ice cream ball to coat, alternating between the plain and white chocolate. Refreeze for 1 hour or until hardened.
Serve in the ready-made chocolate cases, decorating with the kiwi and strawberry slices and sprigs of fresh mint.
